In this study we focus on the
and present an analysis of its function in establishing a C
h account for high levels of
PEPC expression in the leaf. Our results further sugge
st that an intron in the 5' untranslated leader
region of the PR is not essential for the control of

t into the regulation of PEPC
About 90% of terrestrial plant species, including major
crops such as rice, soybean, barley and wheat, assimilate
as a substrate instead of CO
energy-wasting process of photorespiration. The photo-
cycle represents an addition to the C
way which acts as a pump that accumulates CO
of Rubisco so that the oxygenase activity of the enzyme is
inhibited and photorespiration is largely suppressed. C
